Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2009 05:19PM Wndalina wrote: Hello - I finished Rads the end of Nov.  I do have times where I just feel wiped out as well.  Follow up appt rad onc said normal.  I worked full time while going through it.  Didn't miss a beat.  I went back full throttle after holidays and am really feeling it now. I never took the time to relax, when I should have.  When I was warned to.  I know I did this to myself trying to be superwoman - for who?  If you feel it is more than now and then, well it could be something else deciding to join the party - low blook counds as Deanna said, or many things could be the culprit. Yes, it is normal up to 6 months out depending on the person - all of this depends on the person - some never feel fatigue, some feel it during and some after. Good luck and gentle hugs!
Posts.Title: tired two months later ellen58 LeggyJ

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 04:43PM Wndalina wrote: Well hello Nov group!  I have been on the OCT group.  I started mid-Oct.  I have 4 more boosts to go!  I am VERY tired this week.  It kind of hit me all of a sudden.  Or maybe it was last week when my 5 year old broke his arm and I got a Horrible cold and 3 meetings in one day.... hmmm.. HAHA! Kidding aside, I am very tired now.  2 boosts down.  I am dosing up on the cream more now.  Much more sore today than ever before.  I just thank god I have two days off, 3 treatments, 1 day off and then my final one! Yippee!  I changed my appt time that day to 8:45am so I could go home and spend the day ALONE, home on the couch doing nothing but relaxing (until noon when I plan on a celebratory cocktail!).  Sending the kid to day care and making the big kid work that day and hubby will work as well - lucky me! Well, I look forward to finishing up in Nov, starting Tamox in Dec.  I must say. time feels like it has just moved along for me.  I really can't believe I had already done 30 treatments.  WOW! I will drop in again soon! Wendy
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 04:54PM Wndalina wrote: Update - med onc called in Effexor for me starting at 37.5mg.  I couldn't get to the pharm today to pick it up - its on tomorrows agenda.  I will let you know how it works out - the hormonal therapy area on this site has proven to give me enough umpf to ask for it - In a few weeks I should know more - I sure hope it works - or maybe my staff and family hope it works - hehe... 31 down and 3 to go as of today -whew!  I do notice my radiated breast does seem to be getting a little smaller - but nothing too dramatic.  VERY tired still - fast food again tonight - :-( Take care!
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2008 07:06PM Wndalina wrote: Well, 1 more tx to go!  I picked up my Effexor today - I will start tomorrow.  Starting Tamoxifen Dec 26th - hopefully the Effexor will limit some of the SE's. Friday morning 8:45 my LAST rads!  WOW - 7 weeks done! Ahhh... Happy THanksgiving all!
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 07:25AM Wndalina wrote: Ivy - there are quite a few out there doing both - look at the hormonal therapy page and I remember seeing, recently, a thread about doing both. My doc had me wait - and then I elected to wait TX until after the holidays. He said he would prescribe Effexor for me whenever I decided I needed it, I did some research and placed a call on Friday to start it even before the TX.  I think it will really help and know the end result is much more worth it than the fact I have to take an Antidepressant. I must say I am one that suffers through a headache before I take tylenol - if I do at all.  So this is a big step for me and I must say in addition I am excited about it - I really hope it does it - I want some more balance...... God speed to all.
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2009 01:58AM Wndalina wrote: Hello folks!  I actually had some troubles last week when my radiated breast started getting really warm and sore.  So sore i finally called the plastic surgeon, he referred me to radiologist.  Turns out its mastisis (sp?).  Using the steroid cream again a few times a day and it is better.  The breast was swollen and I couldn't wear a bra.  It was horrible.  I feel much better and wore a bra today.  Guess just when we think it is all over, it really never is huh? Oh well, life goes on (and it is all worth it). Cheers!
Posts.Title: SEPTEMBER 2008 rads group NancyD NancyD

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2009 07:01PM Wndalina wrote: Someone suggest taking tylenol or motrin.  I have some stronger stuff left over from surgery - if hubby will drive me, I might take the stronger stuff.  I have to go in April - silly to stress now, but after having 7 years of no worries or pain, it does concern me - we all have our quirks right?  Its better than not going at all!  Have a great day all!
Posts.Title: SEPTEMBER 2008 rads group NancyD NancyD

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2009 01:46AM Wndalina wrote: I am nervous about my first mamm - I was a DDD before and they were virtually painless, I had a reduction at the same time as surgery and now they are a C - I wonder how they will get in there - now I know why most people don't like them....  I don't go until May but I am fearful of it for sure! We will get through this - we have gotten through more...
Posts.Title: SEPTEMBER 2008 rads group NancyD NancyD

Posts.Content: Wndalina wrote: Has anyone else done this?  I am scheduled for Friday for lumpectomy - breast reduction and a SNB.  I have the nuclear injection tomorrow - a bit nervous for that - I hear it burns for a few minutes... I know I have a longer recovery than if I just had the lumpectomy - but reducing my recurrance rate was crucial to me and my choice.  DDD to what I hope will be a low C - if there is enouhg left for it - depending on the tissue removed. So - anyone else do a reduction?  Thanks - a bit nervous here - not of surgery, I can deal with that and could use the sleep - but the healing and out of work for 2 weeks... Thoughts? Wendy Dx 8/5/2008, DCIS, Stage 0, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast reduction with lumpectomy Wndalina Wndalina

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2008 07:02AM - edited Sep 11, 2008 07:03AM by Wndalina Oncologist recommended a lumpectomy (with rads and hormonal t).  I asked about mastectomy - she thought that would be extreme for now - I am 38 - was 37 last month - wasnt on mamm last year and it is this year.  I have some clusters of DCIS on left side - mom had lumpectomy lcis, two aunts - great aunts - dbl mas.  So I asked about reducing them - she said there is a benefit - cancer grows in fat tissue and the less fat tissue the better your odds - no major odds, but it would better 'em.  She works with my PS often so they have a great working relationship.  I am realy happy about that - I too an neurotic about cleansing in hospital and wounds... Thanks for the reminder - it never hurts! The doc thought I was thinking clearly - going from DDD to nothing would have been extreme on my mental too - and she didn't think it was warranted now.  She will take ALOT more than needed and that will be great.  She elected to do SNB as well so less chance to go back in. IF it comes back (in my head it is when) I will lose the girls - thats fine if it comes to that.  But this is my baby steps I guess. Thanks for the feedback folks! Oh yes - both breasts - left one will have the lumpectomy - and reduction, right one just reduced - Breast MRI clear.
Posts.Title: Breast reduction with lumpectomy Wndalina Wndalina
